org.platanios.learn.combination.error

Class PowerSetVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.classification.reflect.perception.PowerSetVector
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AgreementRatesPowerSetVector, ErrorRatesPowerSetVector

    abstract class PowerSetVector
extends java.lang.Object
    A general implementation for storing elements indexed by a power set of integers (for example, indexed by: [0], [1], [2], [0,1], [0,2], [1,2] and [0,1,2]) as one-dimensional arrays and providing ways of accessing those elements.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double[] array
      The array that contains the stored elements.
      private int highestIndex
      The number of elements of the whole set, out of which the power set is constructed.
      private int highestOrder
      The highest cardinality of sets to consider, out of the whole power set.
      com.google.common.collect.BiMap<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>,java.lang.Integer> indexKeyMapping
      A mapping between the power set indexing of those elements and their one-dimensional array indexing.
      int length
      The total number of elements (that is equivalent to the length of the one-dimensional array storing all those elements).
      private int lowestOrder
      The smallest cardinality of sets to consider, out of the whole power set.
      private boolean onlyEvenCardinalitySubsets
      Boolean value indicating whether or not to only consider sets of even cardinality, out of the whole power set.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PowerSetVector(int highestIndex, int lowestOrder, int highestOrder)
      Constructs a power set indexed vector stored as a one-dimensional array.
      PowerSetVector(int highestIndex, int lowestOrder, int highestOrder, boolean onlyEvenCardinalitySubsets)
      Constructs a power set indexed vector stored as a one-dimensional array, where an option is given on whether or not to only consider sets of even cardinality within the power set.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Builds the mapping between the power set indexes and the one-dimensional indexes of the elements.

    • Field Detail

      • array

        public double[] array
        The array that contains the stored elements.

      • length

        public final int length
        The total number of elements (that is equivalent to the length of the one-dimensional array storing all those elements).

      • indexKeyMapping

        public final com.google.common.collect.BiMap<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>,java.lang.Integer> indexKeyMapping
        A mapping between the power set indexing of those elements and their one-dimensional array indexing.

      • highestIndex

        private final int highestIndex
        The number of elements of the whole set, out of which the power set is constructed.

      • lowestOrder

        private final int lowestOrder
        The smallest cardinality of sets to consider, out of the whole power set.

      • highestOrder

        private final int highestOrder
        The highest cardinality of sets to consider, out of the whole power set.

      • onlyEvenCardinalitySubsets

        private final boolean onlyEvenCardinalitySubsets
        Boolean value indicating whether or not to only consider sets of even cardinality, out of the whole power set. That is useful when considering the agreement rates constraints in the error rates estimation problem, where the agreement rates of a subset of functions with odd cardinality can be written in terms of the agreement rates of all subsets of functions of even cardinality less than the original subset cardinality.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PowerSetVector

        public PowerSetVector(int highestIndex,
                      int lowestOrder,
                      int highestOrder)
        Constructs a power set indexed vector stored as a one-dimensional array.
        Parameters:

        lowestOrder - The smallest cardinality of sets to consider, out of the whole power set.
        highestOrder - The highest cardinality of sets to consider, out of the whole power set.

      • PowerSetVector

        public PowerSetVector(int highestIndex,
                      int lowestOrder,
                      int highestOrder,
                      boolean onlyEvenCardinalitySubsets)
        Constructs a power set indexed vector stored as a one-dimensional array, where an option is given on whether or not to only consider sets of even cardinality within the power set.
        Parameters:
        highestIndex - The number of elements of the whole set, out of which the power set is constructed.
        lowestOrder - The smallest cardinality of sets to consider, out of the whole power set.
        highestOrder - The highest cardinality of sets to consider, out of the whole power set.
        onlyEvenCardinalitySubsets - Boolean value indicating whether or not to only consider sets of even cardinality, out of the whole power set.

        Builds the mapping between the power set indexes and the one-dimensional indexes of the elements.
        Returns:
        A BiMap containing the mapping between the power set indexes and the one-dimensional indexes of the elements.
